refnamediv.refpurpose: Dumps and load bogofilter database files

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Bogoutil is part of the bogofilter Bayesian spam filter package.
It is used to dump and load bogofilter's Berkeley DB databases to and from text files.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS
refsect1.para: The -d option tells bogoutil to print the contents of the specified database file to stdout.
The -l option tells bogoutil to load the data on stdin into the specified database file.
The -v option produces verbose output on stderr. This option is primarily useful for debugging.
The file.db is the path to the database file that bogoutil reads or writes.
The -h option prints the help message and exits.
The -V option prints the version number and exits.

refsect1.title: DATA FORMAT
refsect1.para: bogoutil reads and writes text files where each nonblank line consists of a word, any amount of horizontal whitespace, and a numeric word count. Blank lines are skipped.

refsect1.title: RETURN VALUES
refsect1.para: 0 for successful operation. 1 for most errors. 2 for I/O or other errors. Error 2 usually means that something is seriously wrong with the database files.

refsect1.title: AUTHOR
refsect1.para: For updates, see the bogofilter project page.
